messages.subject: Re: [UnschoolingDiscussion] Night wetting /Julie S. ducking!...
messages.msgSnippet: We finally closed up the house and turned on the ac. Don t see turning it off anytime soon. Figures. I made sure I was ready for the cold weather this year.
messages.messageBody:
We finally closed up the house and turned on the ac. Don't see turning it
off anytime soon. Figures. I made sure I was ready for the cold weather this
year. Every year I don't worry about cold weather clothes for the kids. And
every year when it gets cold for awhile, I'm stuck in finding anything for
them to wear. Usually by that time, the stores start having spring fashions
out. So this year I prepared early. Each kid is set with long pants and
sweaters and even gloves this year. The kids complained last year at sports
camp that it was hard to run with their hands in their pockets. So far it's
all just been sitting in the closets.

Mary B.
http://www.homeschoolingtshirts.com

messages.subject: Re: [UnschoolingDiscussion] Night wetting /Julie S. ducking!...

-pam



I live in Stafford County, VA.

glena

messages.subject: Re: [UnschoolingDiscussion] Night wetting /Julie S. ducking!...
messages.msgSnippet: In a message dated 1/3/2004 4:34:54 PM Eastern Standard Time, mummy124@bellsouth.net writes: I m sitting here actually contemplating on if I will need to turn
messages.messageBody:
In a message dated 1/3/2004 4:34:54 PM Eastern Standard Time,
mummy124@... writes:
I'm sitting here actually contemplating on if I will need to turn the ac
back on. I was hoping not to but the next few days are supposed to be in the
low 80's. I don't get much of a breeze in the house so I'll hold a bit
longer and see what happens.



Mary B.



In VA it was near 80 today (77 around noon, the last time I checked). By
Friday morning it's supposed to be 12 degrees FREEZING!

Amazing weather lately.

glena
